metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4607 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the LZO algorithm variant in Oberhumer liblzo2 andlzo-2 before 2.07 on 32-bit platforms might allow remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via a crafted Literal Run.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4607` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblzo2-2 - 2.06-1.2ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

krfb - 4:4.13.97-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lzo2 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.06-1.2ubuntu2').
krfb package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.13.97-0ubuntu2').
grub2 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and needs fixing.
